conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the charged ball between parallel plates.
Ball falls vertically due to gravity initially, trajectory changes to 45-degree angle when voltage is applied.
Identify forces: gravitational force acts vertically downward, electric force acts when voltage is applied.
Electric force on the ball is given by F_e = qE.
Electric field E between plates is E = U/d.
Net force has equal vertical and horizontal components when voltage is applied.
Vertical component of net force must balance weight G.
Horizontal component is due to electric force F_e.
Since trajectory is at 45-degree angle, F_e = G.
Substitute E = U/d into qE = G to get q(U/d) = G.
Final answer: charge amount of the ball should be q = Gd/U.
